info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:52PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm with heavy rains will impact Tioga Pass and areas west of Lee Vining through 600 PM PDT... At 449 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm between Tioga Pass and Lee Vining. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Pea size hail and rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall may result in rock slides and rapidly increasing flows on creeks and streams in the Tioga Pass and Lee Vining Creek areas near and south of Highway 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
